item.title: A Not-How-To Compose a Map Theme with "Wrong Note" Arpeggios (Rescoring Shovel Knight / Opaloid Kingdom)
item.description: In this Not-How-To anti-tutorial, I compose game music (map theme) inspired by the “Wrong-Note” prelude, as I wrote & videoed in The “Wrong-Note” Prelude of Final Fantasy I (1987 NES). After the arpeggios there’s an ascending-fifths (aka “mountain”) sequence and a classic ii-V-(I reinterpreted as III) turnaround. I recommend skipping with the use of timestamps, unless the composing process itself interests you or maybe viewing in the background.

item.title: The "Wrong-Note" Prelude of Final Fantasy I (1987 NES)
item.description: The very original NES prelude way back in 1987 from Final Fantasy I behaves differently from the ones to follow, as we’ll se Nobuo himself demonstrating. I hear a swirling kaleidoscope in the inverted arpeggios, so I cover them with the guitar. Let’s peek into the colored glass and some untapped game music potential.

item.title: Single Unveiled: "Prelude (NES Ver. Final Fantasy I)"
item.description: Let’s Play Final Fantasy I - with Guitar! “Prelude” (NES Version specifically) and “Game Over” for starters. Konsta Airisto’s mage art captures nicely the hidden music theory wizardries in the game’s soundtrack. I now explain the journey that awaits us (EP and Album to come).

item.title: Exploring "To the Land of No Return"
item.description: To the Land of No Return: A postlude that opens with a minor romanesca and reflects on the opening track.

item.title: Exploring "When Shadows Take Over"
item.description: When Shadows Take Over: the final “let’s explore dark, minor modal mixture” of this album.

item.title: Exploring "Goblins Lurking in the Darkness"
item.description: Goblins Lurking in the Darkness: the most blatant dungeon synth parody of this album.

item.title: Exploring "Angels Carried Me Away"
item.description: Angels Carried Me Away: choral style improvisation with the guitar = PITA.

item.title: Exploring "Crystalline Chaotic Caves"
item.description: Crystalline Chaotic Caves: textural exploration, F.Sor etouffez, perhaps a dungeon synth parody or a game cave theme.

item.title: Exploring "Windless Deserted Island"
item.description: Windless Deserted Island: “a first inversion harmony, or a phrygian clausula tenorizans?”

item.title: Exploring "Strong Currents in the Unknown Waters"
item.description: Strong Currents in the Unknown Waters: an arpeggio interlude, this time with dark, minor modal mixture.

item.title: Exploring "It's Time to Set The Sails"
item.description: It’s Time to Set The Sails: I ripped of an unknown composer’s “Forest Theme” from Terra Incognita, a Net Yaroze demo game.

item.title: Exploring "Goodbye Faraway Peaceful Town"
item.description: Goodbye Faraway Peaceful Town: instead of a shepherd in Arcadia, I associate romanesca with town themes.

item.title: Exploring "Revelations in Ancient Tombs"
item.description: Revelations in Ancient Tombs: what happens when you apply “chroma”, Gesualdo-style, on a romanesca?

item.title: Exploring "Prelude to a Foreboding"
item.description: Prelude to a Foreboding: The static use of the arpeggio motive creates tension; “trailer music” vibes.

item.title: Exploring "Autumn Moon Dance"
item.description: Autumn Moon Dance: This dance-like motive unfolds in a “minor-variant romanesca”.

item.title: Exploring "Doppelganger Takes Over"
item.description: Doppelganger Takes Over: The motif is one of my favorite fantasy tropes, albeit rare: it sounds quite dark.

item.title: Exploring "Twilight in the Marshlands"
item.description: Twilight in the Marshlands: This motif, I feel is rather soundtrack-like, serious and heavy.

item.title: Exploring "Waltz with Me Moose Giants"
item.description: Waltz with Me Moose Giants: a chameleon motive, very useful for weaving counterpoint.

item.title: Exploring "Fireflies Circling in the Rain"
item.description: Fireflies Circling in the Rain: The flourishing motif changes along with the underlying modes or scales.

item.title: Exploring "Chilly Nights, Quiet Winds"
item.description: Chilly Nights, Quiet Winds: a meandering motive searchs out and seeks, perhaps for a warmer breeze.

item.title: Exploring "False Relations in an English Town"
item.description: False Relations in an English Town: “Dalza’s basse danse meets the english cadence”.

item.title: Exploring "Wherever The Wind Takes Me"
item.description: Arpeggiating a single motive results in a deceptively simple prelude. Let’s delve into this audio dungeon - timestamps as a map, motif as a compass.

item.title: Album Unveiled: "Wherever The Wind Takes Me"
item.description: Welcome dungeon crawling the nylon guitar! Don’t let the pastoral, Arcadian art by Konsta Airisto fool you - here be music theory dragons. Special mention to galant partimento / scale-degree schemata by R. Gjerdingen, G. Sanguinetti & other wizard legends.

item.title: About
item.description:
• I play game guitar covers, then decrypt music theory to compose game music soundtracks.
  • Perhaps find my Works (latest to earliest)
  • I play a nylon-stringed Godin guitar; engrave scores by coding them in(to) LilyPond; program Csound synths for ‘summoning’ (I try make them as alive as possible);
  • I use ecasound, a multitrack recorder to mix my music in the command line.
  • A most beautiful thing: all this enables an almost complete plaintext workflow.

If you have commissions or questions perhaps, don’t hesitate to Contact me!
